intro: Ricinocarpus irazuensis, commonly known as the Irazu sycamore, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Costa Rica. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and unique floral structures. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests at higher elevations. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
